articles.headline: A Cyberattack ‘the World Isn’t Ready For’
articles.snippet: In May, a so-called ransomware attack hit computers in over 150 countries. But two weeks earlier, one security expert found something a lot worse.
articles.abstract: In May, a so-called ransomware attack hit computers in over 150 countries. But two weeks earlier, one security expert found something a lot worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — There have been times over the last two months when Golan Ben-Oni has felt like a voice in the wilderness.

articles.headline: Martin Shkreli, ‘Pharma Bro,’ Prepares for Trial: ‘I’m So Innocent’
articles.snippet: The former hedge fund manager, vilified by the public and politicians after increasing the price of a prescription drug, is facing eight counts of securities and wire fraud.
articles.abstract: The former hedge fund manager, vilified by the public and politicians after increasing the price of a prescription drug, is facing eight counts of securities and wire fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Martin Shkreli, former hedge fund manager, “pharma bro” and self-styled bad boy, sat in federal court for a hearing on Monday before his fraud trial begins next week.

articles.headline: Why Migrants Keep Risking All on the ‘Deadliest Route’
articles.snippet: The grim fates of two Senegalese brothers match those of a growing number of young African men who are determined to reach Europe — or die trying.
articles.abstract: The grim fates of two Senegalese brothers match those of a growing number of young African men who are determined to reach Europe — or die trying.
articles.lead_paragraph: TONGO, Senegal — Amadou Anne, the oldest son, tried first.
articles.byline: By Dionne Searcey and Jaime Yaya Barry

articles.headline: Nancy Pelosi Tells Democratic Critics, ‘I Think I’m Worth the Trouble’
articles.snippet: Ms. Pelosi, under fire after a Democrat lost a high-profile special election in Georgia, parried renewed questions about her leadership of the party.
articles.abstract: Ms. Pelosi, under fire after a Democrat lost a high-profile special election in Georgia, parried renewed questions about her leadership of the party.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Democratic leader, Nancy Pelosi, strolled before the cameras on Thursday with defeat at her back once more, projecting a well-worn swagger — brash, defiant, more than a little off key — as she insisted that her moment had not passed.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Does God Want You to Spend $300,000 for College?
articles.snippet: The retail price of joining Father John. I. Jenkins at the University of Notre Dame is climbing ever higher. Here, the last in a series on faith and finance.
articles.abstract: The retail price of joining Father John. I. Jenkins at the University of Notre Dame is climbing ever higher. Here, the last in a series on faith and finance.
articles.lead_paragraph: SOUTH BEND, Ind. — In the remarks he prepared for his parting address to the University of Notre Dame class of 2017, Rev. John I. Jenkins urged the graduating seniors to turn and applaud their families.
